title: Applying a Tourniquet for Severe Bleeding
brief: How to properly apply a tourniquet to stop life-threatening bleeding from extremities.
steps: Place tourniquet around the extremity between the wound and the heart, 5 to 10 centimeters above the wound site.
Never place directly over the wound or a fracture.
Use a stick as a handle to tighten the tourniquet.
Tighten only enough to stop blood flow completely.
Bind the free end of the stick to the limb to prevent unwinding.
Clean and bandage the wound after securing the tourniquet.
warnings: Leaving a tourniquet too long can cause gangrene and limb loss
Improper application can cause permanent nerve and tissue damage
Lone survivors should never remove an applied tourniquet
In buddy system, release pressure every 10-15 minutes for 1-2 minutes to prevent limb loss
